intro: Cyanea hamatiflora subsp. hamatiflora, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and elliptic, often with a waxy surface. It plays an important ecological role in its native ecosystem, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaii.
